pr_title: CLDR-11431 Add approximatelySign to LDML number symbols

timeline.bodyText: I suspect you should trim this (and any others that have leading or trailing whitespace).
timeline.author: macchiati
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -7126,6 +7126,7 @@ Warnings: All cp values have U+FE0F characters removed. See /annotationsDerived/
 			<percentSign>%</percentSign>
 			<plusSign draft="contributed">+</plusSign>
 			<minusSign draft="contributed">-</minusSign>
+			<approximatelySign>約 </approximatelySign>

replies.bodyText:
Glad you noticed!
I kept the non-breaking space here because we want the output to be 約 100 and there is no algorithm to add a space between the sign and the number.  Since the sign is only going to be interpolated into pattern strings that are also specified in this file, it seemed safe to add a space.
replies.author: sffc

timeline.bodyText: should drop this line, and remove true, false above.
timeline.author: macchiati
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2126,6 +2126,15 @@ $Revision$
 <!ATTLIST minusSign numberSystem CDATA #IMPLIED >
     <!--@DEPRECATED-->
 
+<!ELEMENT approximatelySign ( #PCDATA ) >
+<!ATTLIST approximatelySign alt NMTOKENS #IMPLIED >
+    <!--@MATCH:literal/variant-->
+<!ATTLIST approximatelySign draft (approved | contributed | provisional | unconfirmed | true | false) #IMPLIED >
+    <!--@METADATA-->
+    <!--@DEPRECATED:true, false-->

timeline.bodyText:
remove " | true | false"
(no need to add born-deprecated items)
timeline.author: macchiati
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2126,6 +2126,15 @@ $Revision$
 <!ATTLIST minusSign numberSystem CDATA #IMPLIED >
     <!--@DEPRECATED-->
 
+<!ELEMENT approximatelySign ( #PCDATA ) >
+<!ATTLIST approximatelySign alt NMTOKENS #IMPLIED >
+    <!--@MATCH:literal/variant-->
+<!ATTLIST approximatelySign draft (approved | contributed | provisional | unconfirmed | true | false) #IMPLIED >

timeline.bodyText: You also need to add this to the parent element, "symbols", in the right order.
timeline.author: macchiati

timeline.message:
CLDR-11431 Add approximatelySign to LDML number symbols

See #472
